dissertation_title: Optimization of Recycling Facility Locations and Operations in Glasgow

experimental_requirements.overall_requirements: Formulate and solve an optimization problem comparing recycling costs and facility usage for waste management across 12 city zones in Glasgow under two scenarios: using existing facilities only, or opening two additional facilities. Output includes an Excel file with two model sheets and sensitivity analysis, plus a 1-page summary letter with recommendations in non-technical language.

reproduction_tasks.target: Organize provided recycling costs, facility capacities, waste volumes, and disposal costs by zone and facility
reproduction_tasks.methodology: Extract and format data from given Excel (.xlsx) file for analysis

reproduction_tasks.target: Develop two optimization models for scenarios (a) only existing facilities, and (b) existing plus candidate facilities
reproduction_tasks.methodology: Linear programming formulation to minimize the total cost, considering recycling and disposal costs, fixed costs for new facilities, and facility capacities

reproduction_tasks.target: Solve the optimization models and generate results
reproduction_tasks.methodology: Implement models (e.g., using Python with solver libraries), record facility allocations, costs, and waste disposal for both scenarios

reproduction_tasks.target: Investigate the effect of varying recycling capacity of facility F on the total cost in scenario b
reproduction_tasks.methodology: Vary the parameter for facility F's capacity and note changes in total cost

reproduction_tasks.target: Summarize findings and recommendations in non-technical terms
reproduction_tasks.methodology: Prepare a 1-page summary and organize all results in required Excel format

urls.description: Excel file containing recycling costs, facility capacities, and waste generation data for use in the optimization model.
